name: Flow Simulation
description: In this project I used OpenGL and C++ to build a realistic fluid flow simulation. I did this by creating a grid arround a plane. This in the center of each cube in the grid there was a vector. These vectors, when given a direction and velocity could simulate a flow interaction. This was done by using Navierâ€“Stokes equations and setting differnt velocities and densities to the grid at each vector.

name: Project Space
description: Project Space is a fully custom built game engine developed from the ground up. This engine uses OpenGL and C++ to render graphics to the screen, apply physiscs, procedurally generate planets and entire solar systems, and much more. Through this project I developed models and textures that were used to bring Project Space to life, I also assisted with developing the user interface and program the engine itself. My main role in Project Space was as Team Lead. I ensured that our project was subbmitted on time and all our capstone course work was done accurately and efficently.

name: Paper Toss Simulator
description: Paper Toss Simulator is a Virtual Reality experience built in Unreal Engine 4.7. This game has the player tosses a paper ball into a variety of trashcans for different points. These points can then be spent on different skins for the ball.

name: Spider-Man vs. Batamn
description: This animation project was built using Blender. Many of the models were downloaded from mecabricks.com and animated by Devin and I.
